name: cockroach
description: A Pulumi package to create and managed Cockroach DB resources in Pulumi programs.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cockroach` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package to create and managed Cockroach DB resources in Pulumi programs.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-cockroach/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/pulumiverse/pulumi-cockroach/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-cockroach` repo](https://github.com/cockroachdb/terraform-provider-cockroach/issues).

ccIdentity.description: The username (email or service account id) of the CC user that the token should map to.

isRegex.description: Indicates that the token_principal field is a regex value.

tokenIdentity.description: The token value that needs to be mapped.

diskIops.description: Number of disk I/O operations per second that are permitted on each node in the cluster. Zero indicates the cloud provider-specific default.

machineType.description: Machine type identifier within the given cloud provider, e.g., m6.xlarge, n2-standard-4.

numVirtualCpus.description: Number of virtual CPUs per node in the cluster.

privateNetworkVisibility.description: Set to true to assign private IP addresses to nodes. Required for CMEK and other advanced networking features.

storageGib.description: Storage amount per node in GiB.

internalDns.description: Internal DNS name of the cluster within the cloud provider's network. Used to connect to the cluster with PrivateLink or VPC peering.

name.description: Name of the region. Should match the region code used by the cluster's cloud provider.

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes in the region. Will always be 0 for serverless clusters.

primary.description: Set to true to mark this region as the primary for a Serverless cluster. Exactly one region must be primary. Dedicated clusters expect to have no primary region.

sqlDns.description: DNS name of the cluster's SQL interface. Used to connect to the cluster with IP allowlisting.

uiDns.description: DNS name used when connecting to the DB Console for the cluster.

routingId.description: Cluster identifier in a connection string.

requestUnitLimit.description: Maximum number of Request Units that the cluster can consume during the month.

storageMibLimit.description: Maximum amount of storage (in MiB) that the cluster can have at any time during the month.

internalDns.description: Internal DNS name of the cluster within the cloud provider's network. Used to connect to the cluster with PrivateLink or VPC peering.

name.description: Name of the region. Should match the region code used by the cluster's cloud provider.

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes in the region. Will always be 0 for serverless clusters.

primary.description: Set to true to mark this region as the primary for a Serverless cluster. Exactly one region must be primary. Dedicated clusters expect to have no primary region.

sqlDns.description: DNS name of the cluster's SQL interface. Used to connect to the cluster with IP allowlisting.

uiDns.description: DNS name used when connecting to the DB Console for the cluster.

status.description: Describes the status of the current encryption key within the region.

authPrincipal.description: Principal to authenticate as in order to access the key.

createdAt.description: Indicates when the key was created.

type.description:
Type of encryption key. Current allowed values are:
  * AWS_KMS
  * GCP_CLOUD_KMS
  * NULL_KMS

updatedAt.description: Indicates when the key was last updated.

uri.description: Provider-specific URI pointing to the encryption key.

userMessage.description: Elaborates on the key's status and hints at how to fix issues that may have occurred during asynchronous key operations.

channels.description: A list of CockroachDB log channels to include in this group.

logName.description: The name of the group, reflected in the log sink.

minLevel.description: The minimum log level to filter to this log group.

redact.description: Governs whether this log group should aggregate redacted logs if unset.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider associated with this service.

regionName.description: Cloud provider region code associated with this service.

availabilityZoneIds.description: AZ IDs users should create their VPCs in to minimize their cost.

serviceId.description: Server side ID of the PrivateLink connection.

serviceName.description: AWS service name used to create endpoints.

resourceId.description: ID of the resource. Omit if resource_type is 'ORGANIZATION'.

resourceType.description:
Type of resource. Allowed values are: 
  * ORGANIZATION
  * CLUSTER
  * FOLDER

roleName.description:
Name of the role to grant. Allowed values are:
  * DEVELOPER
  * ADMIN
  * BILLING_COORDINATOR
  * ORG_ADMIN
  * ORG_MEMBER
  * CLUSTER_ADMIN
  * CLUSTER_OPERATOR_WRITER
  * CLUSTER_DEVELOPER
  * CLUSTER_CREATOR
  * FOLDER_ADMIN
  * FOLDER_MOVER

diskIops.description: Number of disk I/O operations per second that are permitted on each node in the cluster. Zero indicates the cloud provider-specific default.

machineType.description: Machine type identifier within the given cloud provider, ex. m6.xlarge, n2-standard-4.

numVirtualCpus.description: Number of virtual CPUs per node in the cluster.

privateNetworkVisibility.description: Indicates whether private IP addresses are assigned to nodes. Required for CMEK and other advanced networking features.

storageGib.description: Storage amount per node in GiB.

internalDns.description: Internal DNS name of the cluster within the cloud provider's network. Used to connect to the cluster with PrivateLink or VPC peering.

name.description: Region code used by the cluster's cloud provider.

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes in the region. Will always be 0 for serverless clusters.

primary.description: Denotes whether this is the primary region in a serverless cluster. Dedicated clusters don't have a primary region.

sqlDns.description: DNS name of the cluster's SQL interface. Used to connect to the cluster with IP allowlisting.

uiDns.description: DNS name used when connecting to the DB Console for the cluster.

routingId.description: Cluster identifier in a connection string.

requestUnitLimit.description: Maximum number of Request Units that the cluster can consume during the month.

storageMibLimit.description: Maximum amount of storage (in MiB) that the cluster can have at any time during the month.

database.description: Database value to use in a connection URL.

host.description: Host value to use in a connection URL.

password.description: Password value to use in a connection URL.

port.description: Port value to use in a connection URL.

username.description: Username value to use in a connection URL.

provider.description:
The provider type for the cockroach package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

cockroach:index/allowList:AllowList.description: List of IP ranges allowed to access the cluster.

cidrIp.description: IP address component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

cidrMask.description: Map component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

sql.description: Set to 'true' to allow SQL connections from this CIDR range.

ui.description: Set to 'true' to allow access to the management console from this CIDR range.

cidrIp.description: IP address component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

cidrMask.description: Map component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

sql.description: Set to 'true' to allow SQL connections from this CIDR range.

ui.description: Set to 'true' to allow access to the management console from this CIDR range.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AllowList resources.

cidrIp.description: IP address component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

cidrMask.description: Map component of the [CIDR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classless_Inter-Domain_Routing#CIDR_notation) range for this entry.

sql.description: Set to 'true' to allow SQL connections from this CIDR range.

ui.description: Set to 'true' to allow access to the management console from this CIDR range.

cockroach:index/apiOidcConfig:ApiOidcCon.description: Configuration to allow external OIDC providers to issue tokens for use with CC API.

audience.description: The audience that CC API should accept for this API OIDC Configuration.

claim.description: The JWT claim that should be used as the user identifier. Defaults to the subject.

identityMaps.description: The mapping rules to convert token user identifiers into a new form.

issuer.description: The issuer of tokens for the API OIDC Configuration. Usually this is a url.

jwks.description: The JSON Web Key Set used to check the signature of the JWTs.

cockroach:index/cluster:Cluster.description: CockroachDB Cloud cluster. Can be Dedicated or Serverless.

accountId.description: The cloud provider account ID that hosts the cluster. Needed for CMEK and other advanced features.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider used to host the cluster. Allowed values are: * GCP * AWS * AZURE

cockroachVersion.description: Major version of CockroachDB running on the cluster.

creatorId.description: ID of the user who created the cluster.

operationStatus.description: Describes the current long-running operation, if any.

parentId.description: The ID of the cluster's parent folder. 'root' is used for a cluster at the root level.

state.description: Describes whether the cluster is being created, updated, deleted, etc.

upgradeStatus.description: Describes the status of any in-progress CockroachDB upgrade or rollback.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud provider used to host the cluster. Allowed values are: * GCP * AWS * AZURE

cockroach:index/cmek:Cmek.description: Customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) resource for a single cluster.

additionalRegions.description:
Once CMEK is enabled for a cluster, no new regions can be added to the cluster resource, since they need encryption key
info stored in the CMEK resource. New regions can be added and maintained here instead.

status.description: Aggregated status of the cluster's encryption key(s).

additionalRegions.description:
Once CMEK is enabled for a cluster, no new regions can be added to the cluster resource, since they need encryption key
info stored in the CMEK resource. New regions can be added and maintained here instead.

status.description: Aggregated status of the cluster's encryption key(s).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Cmek resources.

additionalRegions.description:
Once CMEK is enabled for a cluster, no new regions can be added to the cluster resource, since they need encryption key
info stored in the CMEK resource. New regions can be added and maintained here instead.

status.description: Aggregated status of the cluster's encryption key(s).

cockroach:index/logExportConfig:LogExpor.description: Log Export configuration for a cluster.

authPrincipal.description:
Either the AWS Role ARN that identifies a role that the cluster account can assume to write to CloudWatch or the GCP
Project ID that the cluster service account has permissions to write to for cloud logging.

createdAt.description: Indicates when log export was initially configured.

logName.description: An identifier for the logs in the customer's log sink.

omittedChannels.description: Controls what CRDB channels do not get exported.

redact.description: Controls whether logs are redacted before forwarding to customer sinks.

region.description: Controls whether all logs are sent to a specific region in the customer sink.

status.description: Encodes the possible states that a log export configuration can be in as it is created, deployed, and disabled.

type.description:
The cloud selection being exported to along with the cloud logging platform. Possible values are: * AWS_CLOUDWATCH *
GCP_CLOUD_LOGGING

updatedAt.description: Indicates when the log export configuration was last updated.

userMessage.description:
Elaborates on the log export status and hints at how to fix issues that may have occurred during asynchronous
operations.

password.description:
If provided, this field sets the password of the SQL user when created. If omitted, a random password is generated, but
not saved to Terraform state. The password must be changed via the CockroachDB cloud console.

cockroach:index/versionDeferral:VersionD.description: Configure minor version upgrade deferral for a cluster.

deferralPolicy.description: The policy for managing automated minor version upgrades. Set to FIXED*DEFERRAL to defer upgrades by 60 days or NOT*DEFERRED to apply upgrades immediately.
The policy for managing automated minor version upgrades. Set to FIXED*DEFERRAL to defer upgrades by 60 days or NOT*DEFERRED to apply upgrades immediately.

cockroach:index/getClusterCert:getCluste.description:
TLS certificate for the specified CockroachDB cluster. Certificates for dedicated clusters should be written to `$HOME/Library/CockroachCloud/certs/<cluster name>-ca.crt` on MacOS or Linux, or `$env:appdata\CockroachCloud\certs\<cluster name>-ca.crt` on Windows. 

Serverless clusters use the root PostgreSQL CA cert. If it isn't already installed, the certificate can be appended to `$HOME/.postgresql/root.crt` on MacOS or Linux, or `$env:appdata\postgresql\root.crt` on Windows.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getClusterCert.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getClusterCert.
